content.rendered:
Balochistan is an unacknowledged paradise of mesmeric and variant landscapes. The variance of landscapes is a core of the province. Verily, the province offers a vast variety of scenes and opens a realm of fascinating views. Though, the province is not getting the deserving aggregate for its magnificence. Notably, tourist agencies have not yet recognized the worth of landscapes in Balochistan because the beauty of Balochistan is still camouflaged by the tourists.

Balochistan: Unsung Rapture of Pakistan

Since, Balochistan is largely a province of gold-laden mountains, so the utmost beauty of its landscapes is still veiled. It is a province that occupies 44% of Pakistan’s total and still it is not in receipt of the recognition that it deserves. Ever since Pakistan came into being, the striking sceneries and landscapes of Balochistan are out of sight. Whereas, it would not wrong to proclaim that the picturesque landscapes of Balochistan are its fundamental kernel.

The Hidden Gem

The untouched beauty of Balochistan is not traditionally consisted of conventional meadows, rich orchards, grazing pastures, and splendid paddocks. Howbeit, the splendor of Balochistan lies in its dissimilar and coexisting variety of landscapes and sceneries. The landscapes of Balochistan is the treasure hidden within the province. With all its rocky charm and stony beauty, the largest province in Pakistan has something unique and tremendous within i.e. its eye-catching beaches and views that embellished the rough and rocky province. The landscape of Balochistan is quite a drastic change for those who are habituated to the conventional norms of exquisiteness.

A Pearl in Sandy Desert

With all its gold-laden mountains, Balochistan is the most exciting oasis cuddled up in the midst of the sandy desert. The water spurting out of a barren mountain is a magically beautify the province and the deep blue sea grazing the pebbled shore. Adorned with the magical landscapes and sceneries, the largest Province of Pakistan has set its own standard of adoration.

Staggering Landscapes of Balochistan

As a matter of fact, the gold-laden province is home to a number of conspicuous and pleasing landscapes. The staggering landscapes of Balochistan are the soul of Balochistan. The following are the preeminent 10 tourist magnetism and blissful places in the enigmatic province of Pakistan;

1.Kund Malir Beach, Kund Malir, Balochistan

Being one of the most striking landscapes of Balochistan, it has an immense spell on the province. The Kund Malir Beach is one of the most outlandish beaches and definitely one of the top tourist attractions in Pakistan. The beauty of this mesmeric land is still untouched by the visitors. The lavish sky in the morning and a clear sky, embellished with shimmery stars, amplifies the charisma of the land. However, the charm of this landscape at the night is as breath-taking as in the morning. The crystal clear water is the basic entity of the landscape. The lure and bait of the place are unfathomable that have a definite competency to induce anyone.

 2.Pir Ghayb (An Invisible Saint) waterfalls

Pir Ghayb or Invisible Saint Waterfalls is essentially a mesmeric visiting spot, in Bolan, Balochistan. As eerie as its name, a spooky story is associated with this exceptionally beautiful landscape. The residents of Balochistan are certain of the myth of the Invisible Saint (Pir Ghaib), who was protected by the grace of Almighty from the men of wicked King who had intended to kill him. The Saint bumped a stick into the mountain from which the water began to gush out and still it pours out after decades of decades.

3.The Hannah Lake, Quetta

Hannah Lake is one of the famous visiting spots about 18km away from Quetta, Balochistan. The lake is famous for its bleakness. The lake is fundamentally a center of attention of the wanderlusts from all over the country. The star-studded sky is the paragon of its charisma. The specification of Hannah Lake is its frosting water and chilling weather that allures people across the border. Midst of rocky province, the place is a blessing for the natives and a beautiful way to flee from the monotony.

4.Waadi-e-Bolan, Bolan, Balochistan

Waadi-e-Bolan is a protracted stretch of a mountain chasm with crystal blue waters gushing in-between. The picturesque sceneries of the place are worth-appreciating. The untouched pearl of Balochistan is essentially an important contribution to the majesty of the province. Surely, a breathtaking landscape is an unspoiled visiting point that enhances its beauty. Essentially, Waadi-e-Bolan is direly highlighting the beauty of landscapes of Balochistan.

5.Ziarat

The mere popular visiting point of Balochistan is Ziarat, which is also recognized as the best place to escape the scorching heat of summers due to its delightfully cool meteorological conditions. With all its grandeur,  the place has a historical significance as it is associative to the shrine of a local saint whose name was Kharwari Baba. Howbeit, the tag “Ziarat” literally means “Shrine.” The place is occupied with a number of the comfy rest houses banquet throughout the area. The eminence of these rest houses is that they are carpeted with lavish green turfs that are dotted with cherry trees producing mouthwatering and juicy fruit which are free to pick and eat. The land possesses the second biggest Juniper forest in the world. Significantly it is considered to be more than 5,000 years old. These add to the scenery by varying the landscape and look exquisite in the winters when they are topped by snow.

Notably, tourist agencies have not yet recognized…
